alert.note: Alert for Central Piscataquis; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Northern Washington; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 11:08PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Piscataquis, southeastern Aroostook and north central Penobscot Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1105 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of thunderstorms 10 miles southeast of Mount Katahdin, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain may result in ponding on roadways and poor visibility along the upper I 95 corridor through midnight. Locations impacted include... Houlton, Millinocket, Patten, Danforth, Mount Katahdin, East Millinocket, Medway, Hodgdon, Sherman, Island Falls, Smyrna, Amity, Mount Chase, Haynesville, Dudley Township, Cary Plantation, Shin Pond, Smyrna Mills, Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument and Reed Plantation. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 244 and 304. US Highway 1 between Danforth and Monticello. State Highway 11 between Norcross and Patten. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Piscataquis; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Northern Washington; Southeast Aroostook
